newsitem.title: USA: Carrington says wound care declines reverse.
newsitem.headline: Carrington says wound care declines reverse.

text.p: Carington Laboratories Inc said Monday that sales in its wound care division, which makes up 80 percent of the company's business, are, at $4.5 million, the highest since the third quarter of 1995.

The company said that wound care sales began to decline during the third quarter of 1995, due to several changes, one of which was the government reimbursement policy which caused a restructuring of pricing involving hydrogels, the company's core product line.
The company said it believes these declines have been reversed.
The company said 1996 year-end results will be reported in February.
